page.title: 12Churches
page.content: {ST. JOHN THE BAPTIST CHURCH}is set on a hill in the centre of Wolvey.It is a {CHURCH OF ENGLAND}Church. The rector of the church is Father Elliott, he has been rector for two and a half years and lives in Wolvey. He is responsible for 3 other churches in nearby villages. Father Elliott takes the services in all his churches and also takes assembly in the school once a fortnight.He has been in the ministry for about 20 years. He says that it is quite hard working in the villages although he likes it here. The church building is Norman with a tower.It is 900 years old.There is a choir of 14 people and on average some 40 people come to the services. Also in Wolvey is a small{ROMAN {CATHOLIC CHURCH.}It is situated on the main road through the village. {SERVICES}are held there monthly.
